result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brimaldi Shaquille Figueroa

records.addlTxt: Received and filed: Justice Point Status Report ( missed office contact).
Received and filed: Justice Point Status Report ( missed office contact).

Defendant Brimaldi Shaquille Figueroa in court.  
Attorney Christian Thomas in court for Brimaldi Shaquille Figueroa.  
Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Parties are seeking to resolve this case in drug treatment court and request an adjournment.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.

ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD VIA EMAIL.
Case calendared for a Scheduling Conference.
Court is in trial on a different matter and ordered case adjourned.
New date confirmed with both parties via email. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.

Defendant Brimaldi Shaquille Figueroa in court with attorney Christian Thomas.  Defendant Brimaldi Shaquille Figueroa in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court to tag aonog with defendant  pending case ( 22CF422).which is set for a balbond hearing. No action taken on this case.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed by Attorney Thomas, Motion for Expedited Plea.

Defendant Brimaldi Shaquille Figueroa in court with Attorney Christian Thomas.  Defendant Brimaldi Shaquille Figueroa in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Sarah Chwaszczewski. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 19, Judge Ashley. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 19.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed by Attorney Christian Thomas.

Defendant Brimaldi Shaquille Figueroa in court with attorney Thomas R. Reed.  Defendant Brimaldi Shaquille Figueroa in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Patrick Ryan.
Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. The court appointed Atty. Christian Thomas, present in court via Zoom, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered no recoupment due to defendant being in custody and indigent. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for a preliminary hearing in preliminary court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Appointment Status Letter

Defendant Brimaldi Shaquille Figueroa not in court, defendant in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing. Next date provided by the clerk in Br. 45.  Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. SPD status of counsel

Defendant Brimaldi Shaquille Figueroa not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied.Court ordered case adjourned CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brimaldi Shaquille Figueroa not in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.  
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Robert A.; Home Depot, Wauwatosa, Rickie W. & Stereo One
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Brimaldi Shaquille Figueroa in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Brimaldi Shaquille Figueroa in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brimaldi Shaquille Figueroa appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 3 and 4. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Sworn as interpreter:  Patrick Ryan
